description: This JSON Schema describes a set of images acquired during the course of a SEM/FIB Tomography experiment.  The images in each dataset is taken using a detector (SE, BSE, EDS, EBSD) using a specific configuration. This Schema contains only the parameters which are specific to the entire dataset. The parameters which are particular to each image is located at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kit-data-manager/Metadata-Schemas-for-Materials-Science/main/SEM-FIB_Tomography/SEM_FIB_Tomography_acquisition_Image_Schema.json. The units are by default to be considred as the SI units unless otherwise specified

entryID.description: (Optional)- Identifier of the dataset. It could be the PID of location where the entire dataset is stored

definition.description: (Optional)- Name of the schema to which this entry conforms. In this case, acquisition_dataset is to be written

user.description: (Optional)- The contact information of the user responsible for the measurement

program.description: (Required)- Details concerning the program (or software) used for aquisition

datasetType.description: (Optional) - To be selected from the enumerated list depending on the detector and the angle at which the sample is measured: * SEM Image * SEM Image 2 * EDS * EBSD * BSE * ISE * ISI * SI * InLens * SESI

numberOfItems.description: (Required) - Number of Items (images, files). Depends on the number of slices

rows.description: (Optional) - Number of rows in the tiled image grab setting

columns.description: (Optional) - Number of column in the tiled image grab setting

tileColumn.description: (Optional) - The selected column in the tiled image grab setting

tileRow.description: (Optional) - The selected row in the tiled image grab setting

images.desription: (Required) - Array containing the images and their specific parameters. No. of images in the array is described by the numberOfItems parameter at the entry level of this schema

title: acquisition_dataset

program.description: (Optional) - Details concerning the program (or software) used for aquisition.

programName.description: (Optional) - Name of the program (or software) used for acquisition

instrumentDetails.description: (Required) - Details giving the relevant components and settings of the instrument.

spot.description: (Optional) - Qualitative index for beam current. Varies with current setting, i.e. 1.6 nA is spot = 1, 3.2 nA is spot = 2, 0.1 nA = spot =-3, so it can also be negative. May vary between different microscope models.

numberOfDetectors.description: Number of detectors used for the acquisition

oneOf.description: (Required) - Details about the detector used for acquisition.
(Required) - Details about the detector(s) used for acquisition.

hotStageMEMS.description: (Optional) - Pressure maintained inside the chamber (in which the sample is housed) during the measurement

identifierValue.description: (Optional) - String containing the value of an identifier

identifierType.description: (Optional) - Type of the identifier to be selected from: *ROR *GRID *ISNI *URL *DOI *Handle *String

eBeamDetails.description: (Required) - Describes the configuration of the electron beam. IRI:https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000007

accelerationVoltage.description: (Required) - The potential difference between anode and cathode. The acceleration voltage adds kinetic energy to the particles of the beam. IRI: https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000001 It is defined separately as voltageDetails, (includes the voltage value, optional qualifier like max or min, optional note of the type string, and a controlled list of units from which one can be chosen - uV, mv, V, kV, MV)

beamCurrent.description: (Optional) - Electrical current which flows along the beam path. IRI: https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000003 It is defined separately as currentDetails (includes the current value, optional qualifier like max or min, optional note of the type string, and a controlled list of units from which one can be chosen - pA, nA, uA, mA, A, kA).

scanRotation.description: (Required) - Angle by which beam scanning direction is rotated

imageMode.description: (Optional) - The type of image mode used. Could be a text or number depending on the instrument.

apertureSetting.description: (Required) - The setting for controlling the aperture size, using either the aperture size directly or indirectly using the beam current. Therefore one of the two properties must be selected: size or current.

size.description: (Optional) - the size (diameter) of the aperture which can be directly controlled using the instrument settings defined separately as distanceDetails.

current.description: (Optional) - the beam current setting which would indirectly control the size of the aperture defined separately as currentDetails

horizontalFieldWidth.description: (Required) - the actual horizontal length scanned on the sample defined separately as distanceDetails.

verticalFieldWidth.description: (Required) - the actual vertical length scanned on the sample defined separately as distanceDetails.

tiltCorrectionIsOn.description: (Optional) - To bet set true if tilt correction is on. IRI:https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/emg/00000037

dynamicFocusIsOn.description: (Optional) - To bet set true if dynamic focus is on. IRI:https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/emg/00000039

dynamicWDIsOn.description: (Optional) - To bet set true if dynamic working distance is on. IRI: https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000026

lensMode.description: (Optional) - The type of image mode used

tiltCorrectionAngle.description: (Optional) - If the sample is tilted, the image is compressed in the vertical direction, i.e. the pixels are not isotropic anymore. Tilt correction adapts the line spacing of the scanning to compensate for this. IRI:https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/emg/00000037

preTilt.description: (Optional) - Sometimes, pre-tilted holders are used and the pretilt angle must be given in the acquisition software because actual tilt = stage tilt plus pretilt.

magnificationCorrection.description: (Optional) - To bet set true if magnification correction is on

iBeamDetails.description: (Required) - Describes the configuration of the ion beam. IRI:https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000016

accelerationVoltage.description: (Required) - The potential difference between anode and cathode. The acceleration voltage adds kinetic energy to the particles of the beam. IRI:https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000001 It is defined separately as voltageDetails, (includes the voltage value, optional qualifier like max or min, optional note of the type string, and a controlled list of units from which one can be chosen - uV, mv, V, kV, MV)

millingCurrent.description: (Optional) - Electrical current used in SEM-FIB Tomography to mill/cut the sample. In this case this is the same as the beam current of the ion beam. IRI: https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000003 It is defined separately as currentDetails (includes the current value, optional qualifier like max or min, optional note of the type string, and a controlled list of units from which one can be chosen - pA, nA, uA, mA, A, kA).

scanType.description: (Optional) - The type of scan E-Scan or I-Scan

dwellTime.description: (Required) - Time period during which the beam remains on one position/stationary. IRI: https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000006

internalScan.description: (Optional) - To bet set true if internal scan is on

pixelWidth.description: (Required) - the actual width of a pixel

pixelHeight.description: (Required) - the actual width of a pixel

horizontalFieldSize.description: (Optional) -  the actual horizontal length scanned on the sample defined separately as distanceDetails

verticalFieldSize.description: (Optional) -  the actual vertical length scanned on the sample defined separately as distanceDetails

average.description: (Optional) - Number of images averaged at each slice

integrate.description: (Optional) - Number of images integrated at each slice

frameTime.description: (Optional) -Time period during which a frame is fully scanned. IRI: https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000014

eScan.description: gives settings pertaining to electron beam scan

mainsLock.description: (Optional) - To bet set true if mains lock is on

lineTime.description: (Optional) -Time period during which a line is fully scanned.

scanInterlacing.description: (Optional) - Number of scans interlaced. This setting splits an imaging area into blocks defined by the number of lines (from 2 to 8). In the first instance, the first line of each block is scanned, then the second one, etc. This imaging method significantly reduces charging.

imageDetails.description: (Required) - describes the settings related to imaging

digitalContrast.description: (Required) - A number indicating the setting for digital contrast (a basic post-processing method)

digitalBrightness.description: (Required) - A number indicating the setting for digital brightness (a basic post-processing method)

digitalGamma.description: (Required) - A number indicating the setting for digital Gamma (a basic post-processing method)

numberOfPixels.description: (Required) - The number of x, y pixels of the image (Resolution), defined separately as pixelNumberType with separate entries for integer values of xPixels and yPixels

driftcorrected.description: (Required) - To bet set true if drift correction is on

zoomfactor.description: (Required) - A number indicating the zoom factor

postprocessing.description: (Optional) - Describes the post-processing performed on the image

transformation.description: (Optional) - Describes the transformations performed on the image

detectorDetails.description: (Required) - describes the settings related to the detector with which the image set is acquired

detectorSettings.description: (Required) - Settings of the specific detector used. E.g., the Everhart Thornley detector (ETD), is a secondary electron and back-scattered electron detector used in scanning electron microscopes, whihc has then particular settings
describes the parameters of a detector such as the Everhart Thornley detector (ETD), which is a secondary electron and back-scattered electron detector used in scanning electron microscopes

mix.description: (Optional) - Signals from different detectors can be overlaid (mixed) and this should, in theory, be the percentage of this detectors contribution to the end result.

grid.description: (Optional) - A number indicating the number of grid elements

setting.description: (Optional) - In case of ETD, this is the bias voltage applied to the detector grid. Note that this block looks different for different detectors.

frontEndVoltage.description: (Optional) - Bias voltage applied to the front end of the detector

minimumDwellTime.description: (Optional) - Minimum possible dwell time for the detector. IRI: https://purls.helmholtz-metadaten.de/EMG/00000006

hotStageMEMSDetails.description: describes the parameters related if a hot stage MEMS is used

heatingCurrent.description: (Optional) - Describes the heating current used in the hot stage MEMS

heatingVoltage.description: (Optional) - Describes the heating voltage used in the hot stage MEMS

targetTemperature.description: (Optional) - Describes the target Temperature set in the hot stage MEMS

actualTemperature.description: (Optional) - Describes the actual Temperature measured in the hot stage MEMS

heatingPower.description: (Optional) - Describes the heating power used in the hot stage MEMS

sampleBias.description: (Optional) - Describes the bias voltage applied to the sample in the hot stage MEMS

sampleResistance.description: (Optional) - Describes the target Temperature used in the hot stage MEMS

pixelNumberType.description: describes the resolution of the image split into number of pixels in x and y directions.

xPixels.description: (Required) - no. of pixels in horizontal direction of datatype number

yPixels.description: (Required) - no. of pixels in vertical direction of datatype number
